problems.title: Reverse Bits (Bit Manipulation)
problems.description:
Problem Statement

Reverse bits of a given 32 bits unsigned integer.
Note: In some languages, such as Java, there is no unsigned integer type. In this case, both input and output will be given as a signed integer type. They should not affect your implementation, as the integer's internal binary representation is the same, whether it is signed or unsigned.
problems.examples:
Sample Input
43261596

Sample Output
964176192

Explanation: The input binary string 00000010100101000001111010011100 represents the unsigned integer 43261596, so return 964176192 which its binary representation is 00111001011110000010100101000000.

Sample Input
4294967293

Sample Output
3221225471

Explanation: The input binary string 11111111111111111111111111111101 represents the unsigned integer 4294967293, so return 3221225471.
problems.constraints: The input must be a 32-bit unsigned integer (or signed integer in Java).
hintsList: Extract bits from right to left and build the result from left to right.
Use bit shifting and masking operations to reverse the bits.
